title: DOOMED / MOODBOARD
description: Fortress Accident's whiteboard. Has three sections: game-related concept art, production schedule and Soona's notes.

dialogueTree.title: Project Dread Board: "Your flashlight slides over an old..."
dialogueTree.text: Your flashlight slides over an old green chalkboard covered in scribbles, sketches and schemes like some ancient cave mural.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "Some of the writing has faded with..."
links.text: Some of the writing has faded with age, but you can still make out sections here and there; photos and drawings have been pinned to the board.

links.title: You: "Inspect the drawings."
links.text: Inspect the drawings.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "These lithe, pointy-eared creatures..."
links.text: These lithe, pointy-eared creatures appear to be different types of *welkins*. You make out autumnal *candle-welkins* casting wax-based magic...

links.title: Project Dread Board: "*Translucent welkins* with organs s..."
links.text: *Translucent welkins* with organs shining under their skin, and even aether welkins -- hailing from the vast emptiness of sidereal space.

links.title: Conceptualization: "This looks like an *enormous improv..."
links.text: This looks like an *enormous improvement* on the classic Wirr√¢l setting. Much more *advanced*. Light years ahead.

links.title: Conceptualization: "If they put this much effort into m..."
links.text: If they put this much effort into making welkin cooler, imagine what they did with the dweorg and the humans?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who are all those creatures? Fantas..."
links.text: Who are all those creatures? Fantasies of a tortured, feverish mind?

links.title: Drama: "You should adopt one of those welki..."
links.text: You should adopt one of those welkins as your *persona*. No longer a mere man -- but a welkin...

links.title: Project Dread Board: "One of the welkins -- towering amon..."
links.text: One of the welkins -- towering among the rest -- appears to be different, however.

links.title: You: "Examine the welkin -- this is impor..."
links.text: Examine the welkin -- this is important.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "It's Vaarahamira, a *high welkin* -..."
links.text: It's Vaarahamira, a *high welkin* -- his face white and scarred like cracked marble. This is clearly a welkin supremacist. The note says: 'All non-welkin races will be purged.'

links.title: Project Dread Board: "The huldur, the dweorg, the humans,..."
links.text: The huldur, the dweorg, the humans, and even headless men... all of them. Purged. Imagine a world filled *only* with welkin! Green welkin, dread welkin... and the high welkin to rule them all.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant can't help but comme..."
links.text: The lieutenant can't help but comment: "An inordinate amount of time has gone into drawing these little welkin creatures..."

links.title: You: ""Why would anyone spend so much tim..."
links.text: "Why would anyone spend so much time on this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some people really *like* building..."
links.text: "Some people really *like* building a world, I think. Even if it's just for a game."

links.title: You: ""Who *are* these creatures? Who dre..."
links.text: "Who *are* these creatures? Who drew them? Are they *real*? I have so many questions..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This looks like *concept art* for..."
links.text: "This looks like *concept art* for a project. It's not really real."

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "One of them is a welkin..."
links.text: (Whisper) "One of them is a welkin supremacist."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm... political commentary. That..."
links.text: "Mhm... political commentary. That one has a great beard too..." The lieutenant nods at the welkin's facial hair.

links.title: You: ""Well. This has been educational --..."
links.text: "Well. This has been educational -- let's move on from the welkins."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just look at those details. So muc..."
links.text: "Just look at those details. So much effort..."

links.title: Empathy: "...and for what? All gone."
links.text: ...and for what? All gone.

links.title: You: "I don't care -- step back."
links.text: I don't care -- step back.

links.title: You: "Inspect the photos."
links.text: Inspect the photos.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "The photo collage depicts barren, i..."
links.text: The photo collage depicts barren, icy landscapes wrapped in perpetual night. You see permafrost and glacial landforms, dead trees groaning under the snow.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "Entire oceans have been frozen from..."
links.text: Entire oceans have been frozen from shore to shore. There are pictures of settlements on dried up riverbeds, abandoned in a storm. Animal corpses in the dark, carcasses and bones.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You see primitive oil rigs built in..."
links.text: You see primitive oil rigs built into glaciers -- by *boreal dweorg* -- yurts under the snow, great mammoth-like beasts of burden...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Albeit dark and cold, this vision a..."
links.text: Albeit dark and cold, this vision also feels cosy in its own way. Like eggnog, or morphine! A much needed respite from our own world.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "A pinned postcard reads: 'The heat..."
links.text: A pinned postcard reads: 'The heat death scenario -- a desperate fight for geothermal energy engulfs the world as Wirr√¢l becomes untethered from its sun, drifting through the Universe.'

links.title: You: "Inspect the schedule."
links.text: Inspect the schedule.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "This is a monthly calendar from the..."
links.text: This is a monthly calendar from the year '50. Cryptic words like 'sprint', 'daily minime', and 'GPI' span the marker-drawn grid -- the grand scheme of production and money.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It looks a bit like an academic cal..."
links.text: It looks a bit like an academic calendar. Only much more *brutal*.

links.title: Empathy: "Everyone is constantly teetering on..."
links.text: Everyone is constantly teetering on the edge of the abyss. An abyss of *production*. These squares look orderly but beneath them is chaos, worry, pain...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "So much pain. Back pain, neck pain,..."
links.text: So much pain. Back pain, neck pain, headaches, carpal tunnel, chest pain... no gym membership can make up for working in this manner.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "'Minime' stands for a 'mini-meeting..."
links.text: 'Minime' stands for a 'mini-meeting'. It's part of a bigger framework for managing work called R.U.N. Station 41 tried to implement it a few years ago, but failed.

links.title: You: "Keep reading -- what happened?"
links.text: Keep reading -- what happened?

links.title: Project Dread Board: "As time goes on, the numbers in the..."
links.text: As time goes on, the numbers in the boxes grow rarer and rarer. The board becomes an empty snowfield in the final days... Only failure and regret dwell in this region.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like they didn't make it." T..."
links.text: "Looks like they didn't make it." The lieutenant looks at the frigid ice field of nothingness.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "A note in the bottom left corner of..."
links.text: A note in the bottom left corner of the chalkboard says: "SEE THE PROD. SCHEDULE FILAMENT FOR DETAILS."

links.title: Logic: "Looks like they didn't make it."
links.text: Looks like they didn't make it.

links.title: You: "Step back and look at something els..."
links.text: Step back and look at something else.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "Your eyes glide over four sections..."
links.text: Your eyes glide over four sections of the imposing green chalkboard...

links.title: You: "Inspect the notes."
links.text: Inspect the notes.

links.title: Project Dread Board: "The handwriting is only partly legi..."
links.text: The handwriting is only partly legible, but you can still make out three slogans: 'Call in, tune out!', 'WIRR√ÇL UNTETHERED', and 'Heat death of the Universe'...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The full text reads: 'Heat death of..."
links.text: The full text reads: 'Heat death of the Universe is the new black'. Another note says: 'The biggest advancement in role-playing systems since the Thirties'.

links.title: Shivers: "Outside, a cold wind wraps the buil..."
links.text: Outside, a cold wind wraps the building in its bosom. Snowflakes in the wind. An old woman passes what the locals call the Doomed Commercial Area. She tries hard not to look at the bookstore windows. It's *unwise*.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Project Dread Board: "This old green chalkboard is covere..."
dialogueTree.text: This old green chalkboard is covered in scribbles, sketches and schemes like some ancient cave mural.
